text: can we pretend 32-bit windows doesn't exist?  it's tier-3 anyway...

elements.text: can we pretend 32-bit windows doesn't exist?  it's tier-3 anyway...

text: I haven't seen such a 32-bit Windows machine in the wild in a long time. I only encountered it via Appveyor. I have no idea why one would want to run julia on it.

elements.text: I haven't seen such a 32-bit Windows machine in the wild in a long time. I only encountered it via Appveyor. I have no idea why one would want to run julia on it.

text: You may still want to run 32-bit Julia on a 64-bit machine if you need to call into a 32-bit dll. That's the only reason why I've ever run 32-bit Julia at least. Binary-only dll to talk to an expensive piece of hardware.

elements.text: You may still want to run 32-bit Julia on a 64-bit machine if you need to call into a 32-bit dll. That's the only reason why I've ever run 32-bit Julia at least. Binary-only dll to talk to an expensive piece of hardware.
